text: On tap at RR brewing pours out amber topped with a sand head. Nose is nice light tropical fruits pineapple and some mango. Taste is more of the nice light tropical fruit notes and a light malt.
Draught at Toronado North Park, 22.4.16. Clear gold with a white head. Hoppy, tropical fruit aroma - papaya. Dry taste, bitter, some nettle. Medium body, refreshing pine-like finish. Quite amazing.
Tap at RR. My favorite APA. Guava, tangerine flavors, superb malt backbone, deliciously hoppy without overwhelming the palate, exactly what an APA should do.

Draught @ Russian River Brewing, Santa Rosa, California (20.04.2016)  

Single Hop Brew 100% Simcoe 

5,8% alk. 13,75 BLG 

W aromacie świeży ananas, mango, papaja, mandarynka. Intensywny aromat. W smaku słodkie z mocnym akcentem chmielu. Głównie owoce tropikalne, żywica, las sosnowy. Średniej siły goryczka z żywiczno-owocowym finiszem. Bardzo soczyste, rześkie, silnie aromatyczne i mocne w smaku. Perfekcyjny balans poszczególnych składowych. Ogromna pijalność. Wyciśnięto z chmielu Simcoe 100% jego najlepszych właściwości. Jedno z najlepszych piw RR. Fantastyczne!

On tap at Russian River Brewing in Santa Rosa, CA-USA. Clear bright gold color, white foamy head. Nose: resin, onions, some pineapple too. Mouth: sweet tangerine, sweet red orange, pink grapefruit. Nice. Really nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap to glass @ Russian River Brewing tap room@ Santa Rosa,CA
A: Deep Amber, clear, small white foam that last long
A: hoppy mildly fruity
T: Medium bitterness, sweet aftertaste lingers
MF: carbonation does not last
OA: Very good pale ale ok to repeat, not look for
Drank: April 14, 2016
@ Russian River 16-3-7: En enkel men välhumlad öl med toner av gräs och hö. Ok
On tap at RR. Poured darker gold with white head. Aroma malty pine. Light carb med bod. Taste cery pine resin hop.

Pint on tap at the brewpub Clear gold pour with thin white head. Aroma is hoppy, very grassy, light malty character. Taste is bitter, hoppy, very grassy, dried hay, very light caramel notes. Palate is light med bodied with good carbonation. Tasty.

Draft sample at the brewpub, Santa Rosa. Clear golden light orange coloured pour with a halo of white head. Aroma is light pine, hint of caramel, little citrus. Nice layered hops on the aroma. Flavour is composed of semi sweet grains, little biscuit. Pine needle. Wood. Palate is semi sweet, highish carbonation , slight sticky hop resin. A very well rounded APA.
Tap at russian river, santa rosa. Deep golden color, white head. Balanced nose has malts and hops. Nice malty base with fruity hops, citrus notes, some pine and caramel notes.

Pours a slightly hazy golden orange on tap with fluffy off-white head that leaves moderate lace. Aroma and taste are huge on the piney citrus of the hops, with just the right amount of malty base. Beautiful pale.
Tap poured clear amber with a medium white head and nice lacing. Aromas of citrus, grapefruit, floral, and Simcoe hops. Flavor is medium bitter with a slightly sweet finish.
On tap at Dry Creek General Store (Bar) in Healdsburg, CA. Aroma is tropical hops. Taste is light hops with a crisp / session-able body. Bold hop flavors without the overwhelming bitterness.
very well done American single hop pale ale. had at Russian river pub. pours nice and golden. nose is tropical. flavor is similar and has great balance to make this a nice afternoon pounder.
Its a good Russian River APA with Simcoe so its exactly what you expect. It displays the hop phenomenally well on a lean crisp malt body.
Poured an amber color from the growler with aromas of light pine, tropical fruit, hops, some light earth and a touch of spice. Flavors follow suit, this is a great pale ale that I wish i had more of.

text:
2L growler.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer. NOSE: hoppy, fruity, fresh. TASTE: hoppy, fruity.

Sampler at the brewpub in Santa Rosa. Peach, some tropical characteristics. Dry and straightforward fruity. Just my liking! Great drinkability, perfect bitterness, great brewing skills. Just an excellent American Pale Ale with some new tropical aromas in there.

3 oz chilled pour from tap into cylindrical taster as part of Russian Rivers everything on tap sampled (16 beers this time around) at the brewery itself. I realize that drinking 16 different 3 oz pours is not ideal for proper rating, but when will I ever have an opportunity like this again?

Great citrus, moderate bitterness.

Draught at the Russian River Brewing Co, Santa Rosa, CA.
Clear golden colour with a small to mid-size white head. 
Sweet American hops, moderate bitterness and malty sweetness in the aroma. Moderate bitterness, piney and resiny hops and sweet maltiness in the flavour. A balanced APA.
Draft. Clear amber. Good frothy white head. Medium body. Smooth and creamy. Clean, Mild moderate bitternes. Very cohesive. Very nice.
on tap at the brewery; a pale ale brewed with Simcoe hops; light amber color; piney, floral hop aroma; piney hops with citrus notes on a light malt base; dry, bitter finish

Bottle dated 3/10. Very crisp. Pine hops. Slight bitter. Absurdly hoppy for the low abv. Hoppy to the point where its like chewing on fresh hops from the vine. Very light on the malt, throwing the balance off.
[2/12/15] Draught at Russian River in Santa Rosa. Clear gold. Aroma of fruity hops. Flavor of lovely juicy fruity hops. Medium-bodied. Very nice and refreshing.
Growler thanks to Nick. Pours a hazy gold with medium white head that diminishes quickly. The aroma is floral pine and citrus. Medium mouth with juicy hop, nice citrus, light bitterness, very nice.

On tap at a local pub outside of Oakland. Another gem from Russian river. And it didn't even punch me in the face

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the brewery. Pours a golden orange color with a small head. Beautiful color, Aroma is hops, tropical fruits and caramel malts. Flavor is balanced between malts and hops; biscuit malts, tropical fruits. Toned down IPA is exactly what this is. Excellent APA.
Taster at Russian River. Pours clear amber. Lemon head. Nose is grass, lemon, citrus, and hops. Flavour is grapefruit, pine resin, lemon, grass, wheat, nuts, and orange peel. Wow awesome beer!

Pour on tap at Blue Palms, hazy orange-red pour with white head, aroma brought notes of nice pine, floral and earthy hops, some slight orange peel, bitter grapefruit come into a hint of bready notes. Taste was on the floral side, some grass and slight pine, touch of orange peel, hints of biscuit, finishing bitter, dry. Pretty tasty stuff!

Clear gold... Piney hops aroma... Flavor is light and dry, tons of piney hop notes throughout and on palate... Nice simcoe pale

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
La croustillance à son meilleur enveloppée dans une membrane herbacée infusée dagrumes. La signature RR est burinée profondément sur celle-là.
On tap at RR. Pours a darkish gold, white head. Aroma is juicy fruit, mango, guava, grass, pine hop. Flavor is clean bready malt, crisp fruity & piney hop. Solid.

From notes. Tasted some time near the summer of 2012 from a capped 500mL bottle with the Nashville crew. Pours clear pale orange with an average off-white head that leaves thin lace. The nose is quite hoppy with dank resin, some tropical fruit, honey, grass, and a bit of earth. The flavor is the same super dank hops, hint of tropical fruit and grass, along with a touch of honey and caramel malt. The body is just under medium with average carbonation and a long dank and intensely bitter finish.
On tap Leggermente ambrata nota fruttata agrumata lieve pesca buon amaro una nota resinosa non molto secca

On tap at Russian River. Pours a clear Orange light copper color. Minimal head. Aroma is citrucy tropical fruits and some piney hop notes. Taste follows the aroma with a nice underlying malt backbone. Very good pale!

Aroma: light citrus, floral hops, light lavender. Appearance: clear gold, small, creamy, white head. Taste: medium bitter. Palate: hoppy bitters continue, flowers, grass. Overall: nice APA, yet lacks some intensity. Pint at Stone Brewing World Bistro & Gardens - Liberty Station, San Diego.
On draft. Booming aroma of grapefruit and pine. Flavors if sticky pint, chewy grapefruit juice. Slightly, pleasantly sticky caramel finish. Superb beer.
From bottle at Pass by bar, Beijing. Clear amber, smallish head. Cellar aroma, dried fruit, raisins. A bit cellar flavours, very dry. Rustic, possibly due to long storage time, but very good.

On tap at the brewery. 
Aroma is very hoppy with lots of grapefruit and other citrus notes. Medium pine and go resin. Light cracker malt backbone. 
Pours a slightly hazy, golden orange with a small, thick white head with a really nice retention. Fairly high lacing and small legs. 
Flavor has a faint sweetness and medium light cracker malt and same faint biscuit notes. Moderately high bitterness with quite a bit of Simcoe hop flavor. Lots of grapefruit and citrus rind with moderate hop and pine resin. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a rather nice, hoppy pale ale with a great Simcoe character. A classic pale ale.
Clear golden pour with a white head. Hoppy pone nose, citrus and slight line hops in the taste. Nice low bitterness in the finish.

Draft at RRBC. Clear burnished gold, shrinking head. Lovely fruity hop aroma, orange, tangerine, melon, pineapple. Tastes moderate sweet toffee and light caramel malt, then crisp citrus bitter hops. Must admit the jalapeños on my pizza are affecting my taste slightly. Medium body, average carb. Very deinkable, really nice.

"What a womderful start to the evening! Easy drinking Simcoe juice, thats what this is. Nothing more, nothing less. Really showcases the hop well. The aroma is faaaantastic! Mellow for sure, but very floral, grassy aroma with a little pine and spice in there as well. Tasty stuff... Man second time even better...just kicked evil twins ass. 8/12"

Draft at the brewpub. Great golden pour with a medium-sized, lasting white head. Hops dominate the aroma - citrusy, herbal, and leafy. Decently dank. Some bready malt. Malty sweetness gives way to a balanced hop punch of grapefruit and leaves. Fairly crisp and dry. Clean mouthfeel as is typical for RR. Extremely tasty and drinkable.
Tornado SD draft pint. Clear bronze color with a small white head. Stanky hop aroma. Flavor brings in more malt with some lingering bitterness. Pleasant.
I'm embarrassed that American Pale Ale means our national drink means a bitter, overhopped beer.
Sampler @ RR. Clear golden colour. Some pine hop aroma, and flavour. An ok apa
Draft at the source. Clear gold color, light retention. Aroma is all simcoe hop!! Nice! Very clean pine finish. Very crushable with moderate pine bitterness. Damn fine APA!

Draft at Tonys Darts Away. Nice surprise, havent had one in a year or so. Bangin Simcoe single hop. Well-rounded bitterness, citrus and pine. Looks, tastes and drinks as good as youd expect. Thumbs up.
Fad: Taster og pint på brewpub. Let kattepis men det er ok for mig, ellers citrus og let cannabis. Smagen er frisk med masser af citrus og græs. Fungerer upåklageligt, lækker lækker øl.

Draft at brewery. Nose is piney with a touch of honey. Fairly clear yellow. Taste is immediately hoppy with pine and sappy character. Bitterness continues through the finish with a peppery note and drying quenching finish. Very nice.
Sample at Boulevardia 2014. Comes golden orange with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, and malt. Taste is grapefruit, tropical, pine, grass, and malt. Very nice!

Draft as part of the full sampler at Russian River. Clear yellow with off-white head. Aromas of grass, floral notes, citrus, lemon lime. Tastes of pine, citrus, floral notes. Medium body with a dry finish. Pretty good.

Sampled on 6/26/2014 at the Brewpub. This American Pale Ale pours a medium gold amber color from the tap. Small to medium sized white foamy head. The aroma is bready, fruity and sweet. A medium bodied American Pale Ale. The malts are fruit, cereal and sweet. The hops are citrusy and herbal. Decent carbonation. Nice balance. A touch bready with a nice grassy finish. Crisp and clean. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.
On tap at Churchills, tasted back to back with several IPAs. Pours a clear amber with white head. Nose is floral, citrus, malt. Flavor is mostly sweet with a long bitter finish. Crisp, good.

Growler. Pours orangey gold with small beige head, pretty. Aroma is juicy grapefruit, pineapple, orange, peach, apricot, lychee. Great. Taste is orange, pine, sweet malt, mango, slightly soapy lingering hoppy finish. Might prefer this to Blind Pig and even Pliny.

On tap at the brewery. Pours golden/copper with a lacy, off-white head. Aroma of citrusy and resinous and lightly piney hops, some pale and caramel malts, light grains, and some dough. Flavor the same with a nice blend. Average texture. A solid pale ale.

Tap at Toronado SD. This was great. Pours golden yellow with some foamy head and lots of lacing. Nose is somewhat quiet with pine and grass. Notes of pine, grapefruit, grassy hops light fruit backbone. Tastes medium/heavy bitter very light sweet. Full sticky body with lively carbonation and long lasting bitterness.
Super fresh and clean. Grassy, peppery, riverstones = good. Exactly what a good PA should be all about. $3.50 300ml Russian River.

Pint at brewpub. Ok aRoma. Sweet. Tad hazed brownish Orange. Good head and love. Bittersweet flavor. Medium body thick creamy mouthfeel bitter sweet finish. Meh. Im not getting what allot serum to. I find the aroma kind of dull.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text:
Draught @ Russian River, Santa Rosa, CA


Pours clear golden with a smooth white head. Aroma of exotic fruits, grass, citrus, lemon and caramel. Taste is smooth, hoppy and zesty with exotic fruitness, lemon and caramely malts. Finish is bitter, hoppy and grassy with loads of exotic fruity notes. Quite tasty and balanced.

Keg at Stone Liberty Station, SD, 18/04/14.
Clear golden with a moderate off white covering that retains well.
Nose is juicy citrics, orange pith, light pine dusting, bitter hop presence, straw.
Taste comprises bitter grapefruit, pine, straw, orange pithdom, tangerine.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a nice lick of hop bitterness.
Solid well balanced APA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Sampler from Russian River. Amber. Some white head. Hop and citrus nose. Hop, citrus, some pine, some pineapple, subtle hint of spice flavour. Medium body and carbonation. Good!
Pours an amber gold color with white head. Hop, citrus, pine, floral and malt aroma. Hop, citrus, pine, floral ,honey and malt flavors. Light body and average carbonation. Citrus finish.

Bottle @ RBBSG II - Thanks Dave! Pours a clear golden yellow with a small of-white head. The smell is simcoe hops, piney, some malt a bit of tropical fruit. The taste is more subtle than the smell - smooth and elegant. Very nice fine carbonation with light body. A nice drinker!
Nice but unremarkable pale ale. Good hoppy flavour comes through, less so than in the IPAs though.

Draught at Toronado, San Diego. Clear golden beer eith a decent offwhite head. Hoppy floral pine apple aroma, mango, pine, oranges, citrus, passion fruit, some caramel, grapes, grapefruit, tangerine notes. Hoppy floral flavor, pine apples, peach, passion fruit, nectar, pine, grapes, pear, some grapefruit. Very, very nice beer.

On tap @ RR! Bright 14 karat pour with a decent ivory cap that left spotting inside the glass. Loads of grapefruit pith, orange zest, and lemongrass accompanied by evergreen and peppery spice. Highly drinkable! Yum!

RR growler from RR drank within a few hours after the Pliny release. Pours a light clear yellow with great lace and a lasting head. Note I hadnt quite kicked a head cold at this point so wasnt getting everything through the Sudafed nose. Aroma is cooling with light peach and soft grain. Flavor is very clean with moderate bitterness on light grapefruit, pine, wood, and fresh steep grain. Feel is very dynamic, light, long. Amongst the best pales I have ever had.
On tap @ RR. Amber yellow with a small white head. Aroma and flavor are of floral hops - pine, citrus, hops, fruit, resin. Sticky and sweet finish.

Beautiful effervescent copper pour on tap at the brewpub. Aroma is outstanding, hoppy and reminiscent of Pliny. Great balance and high drinkability, clearly cut from the same cloth as the great RR IPAs I love so much. Fantastic pale ale, among the best Ive had.

On draft at the brewpub. Pours an amber orange color with a medium white head. Aroma of citrus, lemon, leafy and grassy hop notes. Some notes of grapefruit and gumballs. Flavor is clean, bitter, very smooth and drinkable. Nice crisp carbonation, finishes clean and bitter. Very nice.

Part of a sampler at the brewery. this one poured a clear light golden with a small white head. Not much aroma, which was unexpected. smell of light pine and a hint of citrus peel backed by some very lightly sweet malts. Simcoe grapefruit flavor dominates alongside some piney medium bitter on the tongue. Resinous yet dry finishing pine, medium plus carbonation, and super easy drinking. A really nice beer, but one that I was expecting more from. I will have to try and revisit this one.
Nice hoppy pale ale with complex aroma/flavors of pine, citrus, some tropical fruit (pineapple?). Amazingly only simcoe in this beer.

Tap at OBriens. Pours a clear gold with fluffy white head. Citrus, graprefruit, pine and grass on the nose. Taste is more of the same with the grass coming through more giving it a staleness. Enjoyable.

On tap at the Brewpub in February 2014. 

Clear golden with a small white head. Fresh and easy to drink with fruit, grapefruit and pineapple. Medium bitter with a hoppy finish. A tasty one.
From sampler tray at the brewery. Clear old gold color. Nice grapefruit aroma and flavor. Super nice hoppy ale.

Draft at the brewery. Pours a very clear light golden color with a thin white head. Aroma is a faint citrusy fruit hop with almost a lager kick. Flavor is mild and smooth, with hints of fleshy fruit hops. Very light in body and quite drinkable. Nice session ale.
This beer I had in 2012 at the Oregon Brewers Festival on a bike trip to the Portland Area was one of the best tasting session beers for that White IPA style.
Draft - Leafy grassy hops. Clear gold with a thin white head. Grassy and light bitterness. Decent, but nothin great.
Bottle at home. Pours clear golden with a frothy white head. Aroma is grassy, pine, citrus and some malts. Taste is quite bitter and light sweet. Very sessionable. Good stuff.

Tap at Russian River. Pours a clear yellow with light foamy white head. Aroma is pine cleaner and Christmas tree. Taste is balanced with a slight corn finish and bitterness. Nice but the mouthfeel was light and not something Id seek out on a regular basis.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: On tap at Russian River, pours a clear pale golden with a tiny white head. Aroma is very light, with some spicy and citrusy hops, almost some woody notes as well. Flavour brings out loads of citrus hops, some leafy, earthy notes, and almost a spruce-like note. Very refreshing and well-balanced. Finishes on notes of pine and earth. Great stuff, but a tad overrated I must say.

Poured from growler filled about ten days ago. 

Nice bronzed ale with a finger of light yellow foam and brilliant clarity. Smells of tropical fruits, pineapple most notably, with grapefruit and mango in there as well. Fantastic nose. Taste follows suit with a really citrusy, fruity flavor and lighter biscuity malts - Fantastic flavor I can only imagine would be even greater a week earlier. Medium bodied with lively carb and a wet finish. Man, this is a great beer, I hope they bottle it as ive heard might be in the works. Really, really delicious beer.

Serving type: growler

04-28-2012

Draft at City Beer, 5 min before last call as soon as I hit town. Pours clear gold-orange with white head. Aroma: big grapefruit and pine nose - fresh and "hoppy." Taste: moderate sweetness, decent bitterness, citrus and fruity in the middle. Medium-light body, average-to-high carbonation. Overall: delicious.
Tap at Russian River Brewing, Santa Rosa. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, sweetness, hops and malts.

On tap at the brewery into a pint glass. Pours clear copper with a thin head. Nice lacing, and a sticky texture. Robust flavor with a balanced hoppiness. This would be an incredible beer in any other setting, but with the other options available at RR, this one pales a bit by comparison.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On draft, pours pale with low head, aroma is nice citrus and floral, no cat piss. Taste is fairly dry and bitter. Very nice

Draft at Hollingshead in Orange, CA. Nice, clear copper pour with an OK white head. Light, hoppy aroma with some citrus. Crisp flavor with some hops in the background. Could use some more hops, but still a really good Pale Ale.

Had this on tap at Petes car wash and brass rail in Danville. Went for a Russian River Pliney the Elder, they were out and this was the substitute.
Great beer, I loved the floral spruce aroma which was very similar to their popular IPA. It had the golden color expected of an american pale ale and wonderful flavor with a very clean finish.
Pours a clear Orange light copper color. Minimal head. Aroma is citrucy tropical fruits and some piney hop notes. Taste follows the aroma with a nice underlying malt backbone. Very good extra pale!!!

A: Mildly Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Lots of Light, White Head, Decent Lacing

S: Grapefruit, Resin, Earthy

T: Grapefruit, Resin, Grainy

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Bitter, Midly Drying

Overall, a really well balanced Pale Ale that doesnt over do the hop character and balanced well with the grainy malts.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2013 Btl pours clear dark-orange copper color. Thick white compact head that fades slowly,leaving minimal lacing on glass. Smells of grapefruit, tangerines and an alpine forest, full of pine trees. Very faint sweet, biscuity malt smell at the end. Taste of sweet malt followed by massive amounts of grapefruit and pineapple. Medium body, creamy texture with soft carbonation and a dry,bitter finish. Nice,well balanced beer. Has a fantastic fresh hop flavor and an aroma that is unbelievable. Outstanding pale ale!

Alla spina al brewpub. Ottima Apa, con un freschezza estrema ed un fruttato spettacolare, molto pompelmo, agrumi, arancia e finale amaro che non stanca mai...birra davvero pericolosa, finisce subito...

Huge thanks to yamar68 for this bottle. Bottled on 08/26/13 and served into a tulip glass. Pours a crystal clear amber body with two fingers of thick sudsy bone white foam. Awesome lacing and retention. Aroma is very pine and grapefruit forward with just a touch of crackery malts. Bitter grapefruit leads into resinous pine and smooth bready malts. Falls a bit flat towards the end but then again it is a pale and not an IPA. Very tasty and refreshing. Mouth feel is coating and sticky. This is just a solid, no frills pale ale. Damn good stuff, mmm simcoe!
Rated from backlog. Pours clear amber with a nice tense off white head. Aroma is malty citric fresh fruity. Flavor is as aroma, good hoppy bite lots of fruits and good bitter grapefruit finish

500ml bottle. Poured a slightly hazy golden color with an averaged sized off white head. Aromas of floral hops, pine and some citrus. Tastes follow. Very easy to drink and would make a great session beer!
Pours gold in color. Has a very strong floral/rose aroma. Taste starts very floral and also has hop and spice. Has a strong bitter ending.
On tap at the brewery. Aroma and flavor of grapefruit and lychee. Nice tropical bright notes. They turn mildly soapy after a while, unfortunately. Resinous notes and a tangy bitter finish.

On tap at Torando in SF. Rated 6-5-13.
Pours golden amber with head head. Aroma is floral, citrus, peach and malts. Flavor is light to moderate sweet, medium bitter. Nice long finish.

Strong amber appearance. Deep earthy hop smell. Nice hoppy earthy bite sneaks in before it is balanced out to perfection leaving just the right amount of lasting hops to imprint the sip in your brain.

Pours clear gold with a medium white head...solid lacing. Aroma has nice gras and some sticky icky. Flavor is grassy/rindy with nice grapefruit accents. Mouthfeel is light and the finish is dry and grassy/spicy.

Growler. The pour is nice golden. The aroma is nice and hoppy. The taste is very nice. Get a lot hops. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at the brewpub. Clear light orange pour with a white clingy head. Light pine resin and mild citrus aroma. Taste is bold resin. A bit drying.
Tap. Smells like grapefruit, pine, lychee, and hoppy spice. Taste is grapefruit, citrus, malt, and moderate bitter.
On tap at Stark's. Pours a pale brown color without much head. Mild balanced hop flavors.
Tap-pour is light amber with a white head..nose is nice floral hops, spice, soft, grapefruit, sweetness..Taste is soft hops, spice, light fruits..very nice a easy drinking.
Draught at the brewpub. Pours orange amber with a big creamy off-white head that leaves sleeves of lacing. Full hoppy, earthy and mildly spicy. Nice fresh, clean hop expression.

On tap at russian river brewery. Very crisp all around, nose and body. Great balance. Nice and bright 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Russian River Brewing, Santa Rosa, CA
Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, peach, citrus and orange. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter with a long orange fruity finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

On tap at the brewpub. it pours a clear golden body and a small, white head. The Arima has green pine cones, pineapple and some pale malt. Bitter on the palate, dry and medium bodied, with pale malt notes, pine cones and pineapple. Long bitter finish. Easy drinkable and tasteful. They sure know how to brew at this brewpub. 130806
On tap at brewpub. Press golden with an p off wrote head. Aroma of pine, peach, fruitiness and make. Flavor is sweet and peachy with some malt and pine. Medium body, average carbonation.

On tap at brewpub on 062013. Pours clear golden/ligt copper with a white head. Aroma has sweet resin, pine and citrus: Very smooth mouthfeel with a sweet resiny feeling and a light malty backbone, dry bitter piney finish.
growler thanks to Raiders707. pours a clear ligh gold with a bit of a white head. sweet hop and resin aroma. taste is the same a lot of great hop taste, very light very drinkable.

Pours clear light amber with thin white head. Light hoppy aroma, slightly floral, with grapefruit and pine. Mellow resin bitter taste; fruity sweetness. Light body with soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap-pour is light amber with a white head..nose is nice floral hops, spice, soft, grapefruit, sweetness..Taste is soft hops, spice, light fruits..very nice a easy drinking.

Pours amber with white head
Aromas of pine, citrus, caramel
This one has a great malty base, caramel and nice hoppyness

Another excellent one. Pours clear light amber with low white head. Light hoppy aroma, slightly floral, with grapefruit and pine. Mellow resin bitter taste with lots of fruit sweetness to balance it. Body is light with soft carbonation.

Pint on tap. It pours golden yellow, with a persistent head and light lacing. The smell is very aromatic, like fresh quality ingredients. Balanced big taste, not complex but fantastic all the same. The only critique I have is that its just a little dry for me. All the same, one of the best pale ales Ive had, period.
Amber. Nice hoppy aroma but not huge. Lots of hop flavor that isnt overpowered by bitterness. I would call this an IPA if the aroma were larger. Very nice.

Draft. Copper pour, off-white head, some retention/lace. Aroma of melon/citrus/pine hop, caramel malt. Taste is moderately bitter, pine/citrus, caramel, very light toast. Palate is soft, slick, a bit oily, bitter finish. OK.
Pours a golden pale color. The first thing I smell is caramel. Has a very smooth caramel flavored hops with hints of pine.

Growler. Easily one of the best beers I've ever had. The depth of flavor was absolutely amazing. I think that the only thing holding this back was low carbonation, and that may have just been due to the growler being in a box for a week from CA to PA.
Tap at Toronado. Pours a dark gold with a thin white head. Really fresh pine hop aroma, crisp but not overdone. Taste is well balanced malt with pine and citrus hop taste. Excellent.

Sampled at DLD 2013.  It poured a clear light amber color with a white head. The aroma was hoppy, citrus and grapefruit. It was medium on the palate with average carbonation. The taste was sweet, malty, bready, a nice dose of pine hops, with a light and bitter hop finish. Good stuff.

Tap at Toronado SD.  Clear amber pour.  Aroma is well...all simcoe. I love simcoe.  I also love cat piss, so thats ok.  Melon, pineapple, and peach.  Really sticky beer, love it.  Tast of peach, apricot, cantaloupe. So awesome.

This was from a growler at the shared bottle tasting at the Hampton Inn the night before Dark Lord Day in Munster, IN.  Orange in color.  White head.  Medium body.  Nose of citrus hops.  Flavor is fruity with some bitterness in finish. Tasty.
Sampled at the Hampton.  Clear with a white head.  Noce florl hs.  Malts are light.  A nice pale.

On tap at Tustin Brewing.  Grassy, catty hops coming off a deep Orange body with a wispy white head.   Lots more of those hops in the flavor with grapefruit juice and rind, along with a dry thistlely quality.  Body is fairly thin with just enough sweetness (white peaches and oranges) to balance the hop bite.  Finishes dry with a lastly bitterness and some floral in the aftertaste.   Nice hoppy IPA, very refreshing if a bit one dimensional.
Pours clear amber with a nice tense off white head. Aroma is malty citric fresh fruity. Flavor is as aroma, good hoppy bite lots of fruits and good bitter grapefruit finish

Growler thanks to raiders707. Pours a crystal clear golden color with large pillowy white head that dissipated quickly. Aroma similar to Pliny. Orange, grapefruit, pineapple, mango, and some maltiness. Taste is sweet tropical fruit, with some grapefruit bitterness, and ends with some grassy notes.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2013 On tap at Russian River. Orange pour with a white head. Aroma is awesome. Resinous, piney, all simcoe. You can showcase the hops all you want, but if the base beer isnt good youre sunk. I think Russian rivers strong point is they make really good base beer.  This one was fantastic.
Very clean taste.. the simcoe hops were very nice in this brew.. Russian river does it again.
Poured from a bottle, thanks to the Boise crew.  Very hoppy, citrus, grape, slight grain. The body was thin.

Growler. Thanks j! Pours a crystal clear dark amber with a loose creamy white head. Big garlic and ammonia nose, but in a very appealing way. Piney too. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Toast, caramel, garlic and pine mid palate with a long toasty resiny finish. Really nice.

On tap 4 oz. pour at Churhills Pub in San Marcos, CA.

Clear, bright golden amber, with off-white head and excellent lacing.

Aroma of pineapple, peach, pine, apricot, caramel and bread.

Taste of pineapple, apricot, peach, pine, caramel and bread.

Medium body and medium/low carbonation with smooth mouthfeel.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at brewery.. 10.28.12.. Pour is a hazy straw gold. .5 inch thick fluffy white head. Smell is wet grass, curing dank, grapefruit, pineapple, smoke. Taste is hoppy, simcoe and amarilla.. pine, grapefruit, lemon zest... light carbonation light body. Very nice ipa in any other neck of the woods. seemed experimental here. underdeveloped.
The perfect american pale ale not as choppy as I would have liked it but smooth cool and the perfect specimen

Piney and grapefruit flavor. A great pale ale. I could drink this all day every day. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Beautiful deep gold with a frothy white head. Pine forrest aroma - amazing! Pine notes carry over into the flavor with a sumptuous resiny character. Body is moderate - just right for a quenching pale ale. Wonderful beer.
What a beer! On tap at the brewpub. Super hopped beer, strong fruity aroma, almost no malt beautiful bitterness.

From notes - Killer beer!!! Pours light straw with a pale mild head.  Nose is super hopped!! Rich grapefruit and citrus notes.  Flavor is fully hopped as well, simcoe, grassy, citrus heavy throughout.  Little to no malt.  Light body and super drinkable.

Bottle shared by Darrell. Thanks man. A new Russian River beer, how exciting.

The appearance is clear and light orange hued with a constant stream of bubbles rising from the bottom of the tulip glass. A nice half inch of white head sits atop the beer.

The aroma brings hops, grass. Smells like a Russian River hop profile. Nicely done.

The flavor offers an earthy hop character, citrus, grass. Malt presence is there, but light. 

The beer finishes dry. Light bodied with appropriate carbonation.

Overall, highly drinkable and enjoyable. Another tasty offering from an outstanding brewery.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 07-06-2012

On tap at Stone Brewery. Pours yellow orangish color. Nose is fruity with fresh peaches.Taste is fruity with fresh peaches. Carbonation mild and texture medium. Full of flavor !! Finish is short and sweet and finishes with a bouquet of fresh fruit. Quaff Score 9 / 10

On draft at Stone Brewery. Pours a orange yellow with a white head and aroma of peaches and fruits. Taste is of fruits, peaches, hops, and citrus notes with a sweet, smooth finish. Delicious, tasty brew from Russian River

Tap: yellow pour with thin white head. Aroma is grapefruit hoppy. Flavor has a honey, caramel sweetness moving into a grapefruit bitterness. Palate is sweet/bitter and rather thin but easy drinking. Great flavor and aroma, I could drink a few.
Golden colour. Aroma has some tropical fruits. Quite thick and syrupy. Light bitter finish. Good session beer.
Clear orange with a nice white head. Aroma is danky, fruity, citrus, sweet orange. Taste has a nice fruity bitterness, lemon, citrus. A well crafted pale ale!

500ml bottle dated 6/26 so this was three weeks old when I drank it, perfect. Thanks to bugdoc for sending this to me, appreciate it man. Orange yellow appearance, good head and lacing. Smells like simcoes, hints of cat pee, delicious. Mouthfeel is thick. Flavor is delicious simcoes with a good maltiness. This is a great hoppy pale ale but not something I would probably drink a whole sixer (not that I could ever get one) because it was a little chewy. Very glad to have had a shot at this beer.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 07-22-2012 19:08:00

On draft at RR. Served in sampler. Because of the size the attributes other than taste and palate are a bit skewed, but what I can tell you is that this beer has simcoe written all over it. Very clean, piney hoppiness that finishes crisp and bitter. A really good pale ale.
Enjoyed on tap at the brewpub.  A big hoppy pale, featuring Simcoe hops.  Light orange head and lace sheet.  Very good drinkability.Bang on, juicy.

27th September 2012Borefts warm up -bottle in the Hotel. Almost clear gold beer, good white head. Palate is light and semi crisp and semi dry. Fresh but mild orangey Simcoe with nice floral notes. Mild minerals. A simple beer but really well done - the orange floral hops are lovely.

Draft at the brewpub, served in a sampler. Pours a clear gold color with a small white head. Notes of oily, herbal hops, tropical fruits, citrus, and very sweet malts, with a peppery kick late. Light bodied, with medium-high carbonation and a crisp mouthfeel that starts bitter and finishes clean. Very good APA; not on the level of Pliny or Blind Pig, but was my favorite new beer of the night.

Besides Pliny and blind pig, this was my favorite RR beer I tried today. Golden pour. Great hops for a pale ale. Smooth pine and citrus taste. Good stuff

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler fill, shared while watching the Giants sweep Game 5, 2012 World Series!  Poured a clear golden with medium white head.  Wonderful nose of citrus, pink grapefruit.  Lightly sweet taste, well balanced on the bitter end.
Medium bodied, overall a very good beer.

Draught @ the brewpub, Santa Rosa. Rated on 20.10.2012.
Pours a deep copper colour with a white head. Aroma is really intense and rich with notes of peach, floral hops and toffee. Flavour is very bitter and intense with floral hops, sweet peach, pineapple, grass and grapefruit. Dry fruity finish with high bitterness. More please.

500 ml bottle.  Pours a clear bright golden color with a medium sized white head.  The aroma is a combination of citrus, grassy and floral hops with a mild toasted pale malt base.  The flavor has quite a bit of citrus and grassy hops with toasted pale malt and crackers as a base.  This is certainly one of the standout pale ales that you can try.
Sampled at GABF on Saturday October 13, second sessionHazy golden color, white head. Hoppy, citrus scent. Hoppy, citrus taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium high bitterness.
GABF 2012. Pours a golden appearance with a creamy head. Grapefruity, piney,somewhat resiny, very inviting nose. Somewhat toasty malty, grapefruity, light caramel, piney flavor. Nice stuff.
I love the smell of the hops in this beer.  It is very well balanced and light but hoppy.
Served at GABF 2012. Very clear gold thin head great citrus hop aromas crisp piney grapefruit oh man so good.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2014 Sampled at GABF with Andrew and Moreau. Pours a lightly hazy, bright orange body with light white lacing. Aroma is super fresh citrus hop, light dank herb and incredible pine flavor. Mouthfeel is medium, sessionable and refreshing, the perfect blend of tropical fruits, pine hop,citrus and a cheesy funk dank flavor. Tangerines dance along side nectarines and pomelos! Incredible overall, and perhaps the best of the entire fest for me personally.

On tap.  Pour is a clear golden orange with a creamy white head. Nose is tight with light malt caramel and some nice grainy malt. Good hop profile, notes of citrus and strong herbal presence. Taste is balanced, dry finish, tight balance, grain and faint sweet caramel with citrus and herbal hops.

Thanks to hamilton23 for this one.  Cheers, Steve!  Pours a hazy yellow with a white head.  Nose is grapefruit with intermittent pine.  Flavor is grapefruit pith with a nice malt backbone and pine sap.  Medium to full in body for the style and a nice hoppiness all over.

50cl Bottle @ RBBSG, Courtesy of Dave. Golden blond coloured beer with a small white head and very little carbonation. Clear hoppy simcoe hoppy hinted aroma. Medium to full palate. Finish is bitter hoppy hinted. Not bad for a pale ale!

16 oz bottle poured a clear gold with a small lingering white head. Aromas of biscuit, cat piss, pine, grapefruit and light earthiness. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of biscuit, grapefruit, lemon zest and light pine with a crisp dry lingering bitter finish.

On tap at city beer store in the midst of Folsom street fair... Soooo not the most thorough review. Clear golden pour, strong citrus aroma. Taste is extremely hoppy for a pale ale, basically an ipa+, lots of grapefruit bitterness, pretty much hides the pale malt characteristics. Very fresh floral tasting.

51cl, Bottled on June 26th 2012, new exclusive American brew Anno 2012, from De Bierkoning Amsterdam, complex bitter brew, malty/floral and slightly woody/fruity, easy to drink, balanced, hazy, good head, good brew, yet expensive!

On tap at Russian River. Clear golden pour with a tight white froth. Huge dank tropical fruit and evergreen give way to juicy nectar fruit and floral herbals. Dry crisp finish with a creamy body. Superb.

Tap. Pours clear golden yellow with a small white head and nice lacing. Aroma is grapefruit dominated. Flavor is grapefruit, pine, caramel. Lightly sweet and lightly bitter. Creamy and light bodied in the mouth. A very tasty pale...
Grapefeuit hop aroma. Copper colour with a thin head. Citrus, orange and hop flavour. Thin texture. Very refreshig beer.

Draft @ RR. Clear golden with a thick white head and great lacing. Aroma of pine, pineapple, ganja, floral and some light toasty malt. Flavor is perfectly balanced, firm hop bitterness and some smooth malt, no alcohol presence. Medium body with average carbonation and a dry mouth feel. Such a great beer, tons of Simcoe character and super drinkable, my favorite of the day.

Fast-dispersing white head over gold. Flowery, rose and lemon, breakfast juice aroma. 
Mouth-drying, squeezed tea bag, tannic-bitter grapefruit flavour with softer mango and lychee squirts. Oh yes.
Poured from bottle into glass golden color with a medium head. Aroma of floral, citrus and hops. Some bitterness but the furityness take over.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2013 bottle pours pale gold with a medium white head, thin lacing.  Aroma is big dank resinous hops, very fresh with pine and skunky hops.  Flavor is nicely balanced with bright cereals and pale grass leaving a nice backdrop to the hops which really shine in the finish.  Big and flavorful ending dry with more hop flavor than bitterness. Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma of hops, a decent amount of American hops. Fruity, passion fruit, citrus, apricot and tropical fruits. Malty flavour, hops, quite bitter, some honey. Still manages to be quite light. Light body, malty finish, white bread with pronounced hops notes.

Bottle.  Pours crystal clear, golden straw colored, and still.  The head is rocky and quick.  The aroma is somewhat restrained, but the beer drinks with a full-on assertive lick of Simcoe, with a tropical fruitiness and slick mouthfeel.  The silkiness permits for a lighter body, and this drinks like a refreshing cooler for a hot summer porch.  (#4752, 8/29/2012)

Bottle thanks to some generous soul in Boise. Pours a clear copper with a medium white head. A sweet fresh fruit/hop nose. The flavor is a big very herbal at times brew with citrus, light sweet syrup, very clean and tasty.

Bottle.  Gold/orange pour with persistant small white head.  Pine, grapefruit and slight tropical fruit aroma.  Flavor is a great!  Pine, grapefruit and lemon zest and minor tropical fruit flavors.  Small malt flavor, but its nice.  Soft bitterness.  Medium to light body with perfect carbonation.  Dry hoppy finish.  Very refreshing on this hot summer day.  This is a fantastic APA.

1 oz pour at Russian River.

A - Yellow to orange. Decent clarity.

S - More tropical fruit smells. Hints of wheat

T - Dominating grapefruit and orange peels. Decent bitterness with some sweetness at the finish.

M - Medium carbonation, light body. 

O - I like the hop bill on this. Its a nice balance overall but the malt bill just feels too low. Single IPAs are difficult in my opinion to reach that nice balance.

Hazy glowing orange body.  Large fluffy white head.  Soapy lacing and thick skim.  Nose is a clean citric hop profile--lemon and grapefruit--with some residual pine notes and pale malts.  Flavor is similarly clean and streamlined.  Lemon, pine, and grapefruit take center stage.  Medium to light bodied, moderate carbonation, clean, crisp and refreshing finish.  Delightful.

11/VIII/2012 50cl bottle @ RBBSG - (2012-907) Thanks to Dave for sharing the bottle!
Clear orange beer, nice creamy white head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: fresh cut grass, bit of exotic fruits, grapefruit, white grapes. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: pretty bitter, grapefruits, piny, some citrus, grassy hops. Aftertaste: bit of grapefruit, bitter hops, grassy, little cheesy.

At recent RBBSG thx to Dave for sharing ! 
Aroma: hops, yeasty, citric, dry 
Taste: lovely hop flavour with perfect hopy/bitter balance, some zests, yeast, simcoe, grassy, end is dry , nice one !

Thx. to Dave // one of the 3 RR brews that Dave brought back in his wisdom from the States // finally got to try some RR // 500 ml. bottle sampled @ RBBSG 2012 // light, clear orange with a white head // simcoe in the nose, smell is wonderfully, clear, substantial hops, fruity, lots of lemons, zest, nice // full clear hops, awesome american goodness, crisp, clear lemons, zest. awesome pale malts, white bread, straw, hint grass // mellow easy to drink // nice, nice

On tap at Apex - Pours amber with a foamy white head. Really citrusy nose, with a bit of onion. Super crisp and pungent. Light, clean malt. Taste is super clean, pale malt, with a blast of citrus, light herbal hops, and a long, clean citrus hop finish. Nice light effervescent body. Reminded me of NG Moon Man, but with more pungent, juicy hops. Love it.

500ml bottle received in trade. Thanks! Pours a clear, light amber color with a white head.  Aroma is hoppy, citrus, grapefruit.  Medium on the palate with average carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, bready, a nice dose of pine hops, with a light, bitter hop finish.  A very tasty pale ale.

50cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.,
Thin white head.  Golden slightly hazy pour.  Lovely citrus aroma and bitterness.  A great brew!

Bottle shared.  Pours clear light golden with a medium off white head.  Aroma is floral, citrus, pine, light apple and peach.  Flavour is heavy bitter with a long duration and moderate sweet.  Full bodie with soft prickly carbonation.  Lovely!
Bottle courtesy of Dave, thanks very much!  Clear golden color. Aroma of cut sweet grass and subtle scallions. Taste is smooth, moderately bitter straw. Very nice.

Draft at Monks Cafe in Philadelphia, PA. 

Pours a slightly hazy, pale golden straw color with visible carbonation bubbling up and a two finger frothy white head.  Excellent retention, only slowly fading into a lasting cap.  Large streaks and spots of soapy lacing left behind.

Delicate floral hop aroma that becomes more prominent as it warms.  Slight grassy/piny with subtle citrus and light fruit notes.  Hints of apple, pear, pineapple, grapefruit and lemon peel with a light biscuit malt backbone.   

Medium bodied with tight carbonation and a spicy, floral hop bite up front that provide some dry bitterness that lingers throughout.  This is countered mid-palate by pale malt, subtle citrus and some light fruit.  Bitter but not too much so with the perfect amount of dryness thats countered by bready yeast, biscuit and pale malt.  Im also picking up hints of straw, apple and pear.  Well balanced with great hop flavor making this beer very quaffable.

Bouteille rapportée de Californie par ce cher Beuf. Boul. Bue en compagnie du Slovak. Cette bière est superbe, la robe est dorée et une fine couche de mousse blanche-beige la protège de loxydation. Le nez est tout en simcoe (trop facile), avec de agrumes, aiguilles de pin et surtout des pêches. La bouche est fraiche, la structure moyenne, quelque peu mince mais combien rafraichissante. Lamertume est marquée. Le goût est persistant. Un superbe produit.

Une dégustation offerte par Boul, ce grand bourlingueur qui revient de la Californie.  Le partage est grandement apprécié!  Une bouteille fraîche comme en témoigne sa date dembouteillage: le 26 juin 2012.  Une robe dorée et sa mousse presque blanche.  Un nez de houblons excessivement frais qui parfument latmosphère dun savant mélange dherbes et dagrumes avec une touche de jus de pêches acidulées et de fines aiguilles de pin qui piquent mes narines.  Des saveurs de haute voltige.  Quelque chose qui frappe le gosier.  Des houblons qui sont à leur apogée.  Une base maltée comme une caresse féminine.  Une cohésion qui frôle la perfection.  Une bouche légère sans être mince qui est habilement soutenue par des bulles fines et explosives.  Une finale fantastiquement amère et brillamment longue.  Quelle bombe!
One of the best pale ales I have ever tasted.  Floral hop aroma, like a flower garden, well tended. Mouth full of flavour.  Enough carbonation with pine and citrus notes in it.  Citrus in the finish.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text:
Bottle sample @ 2nd RBBSG, August 11th 2012. Courtesy of Dave.
Dorée, col blanc léger.
Arôme fruité à souhait, délicieuse. Fleuri avec des notes fruitées agrumes.
Palais garde une profile fruité houblonné, belle amertume, cest affreusement facile à boire, frais et citronné, fleuri le tout étant très frais. Petite amertume simmisce, cette dernière est bien placée pour une bière qui reste simple mais drôlement efficace alternant ce côté paille et le profile Simcoe.

Excellent beer. In the glass it has a golden color with a medium head. Aroma is big with floral notes, citrus and crisp hops. Taste has some bitterness up front but is then backed by a punch of pine and citrus. It also has a mild carbonation then has a long finish.
Sampled at RBBSG. Slightly unclear golden color, small white head. Smell malts, hops, very fruity. Taste malts, very hoppy, very nicely bitter and some fruityness. Medium body, medium to full carbo.
I wish they had this as an air freshener! Crisp, clean, similar to Pliny. Refreshing!

Pours a deep gold with a quickly dissipating head. Aroma is a balance of bitter simcoe hops and malt to back it up. Taste follows, bitter upfront and finishes smooth. Very drinkable, not over the top. Another great offering from Russian river!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great citrus and grassy aroma up front.  Taste is a nice and crisp and very hop forward.  Points off for a lack of depth of flavor.  Kind of one dimensional but still that dimension is a great one.
Bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity peachy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter peachy grapefruit flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter peachy finish.

Sampled at Blind Lady Ale House; July 2012
Arrives with an orange tinged, pale amber color that shows a brilliantly clear bright gold hue when held up to the light. The aroma is vibrantly hoppy with a huge tropical fruit focus that more than reminds me of candied peaches, lychee, ample guava, and tangelo zest. This is backed by a much softer, dank, herbaceous, perhaps even a touch woody hop character. The malt is quite subtle, and purely supporting with hints of hay and cracker.

The beer is quite light bodied, has a bit of prickly carbonation, but still has a touch of malt viscosity to it. Amply hoppy, this has quite a bit of hop bitterness to it, and the fruit character is quite a bit reduced compared to the nose due to the dryness of this beer. Still there is an herbaceious, essential citrus oil character here as well as some floral tropical fruit notes. Hints of pale malt dried straw and cracker are just noticeable, but clearly play a distant supporting role to the hops. The herbal hop character is perhaps dominant, a touch menthol, definitely pine like and perhaps a hint of dank hemp oil character; though this last is reduced from even the light touch that the nose had.

A more than nice Pale Ale, it could perhaps use a touch more body / residual sweetness, as this would accentuate more of the fruity hop flavors, but that would also ruin the incredible quaffability that this beer has.

Bottle... Clear yellow ale with an orange hue and a small, creamy, white head. Good retention. Lots of sticky, cat piss and armpit hops in the nose. Medium-bodied with dancing carbonation. The flavor offers medium bitterness derived from an earthy, musky, Simcoe hop bill. Finishes lightly bitter, raspy and dry. Bottle courtesy of richiesd!

Poured from a 1 pint bottle.  A beautiful shade of clear, medium gold from which a pure white head quickly rises to a full 2 inches before settling in to half that height .  The nose is immediately spruce, followed by hints of orange.  My first, and each ensuing sip finds joy in a medium bitter that persists for a wonderfully long spell.  Nice lacing for such a non-sticky head.  Medium body and carbonation.  Smooth, long finish.  Not the best that Ive had in any one category.  But everything about this beer is clearly based on the sum of its parts as it all comes together to produce an extremely enjoyable brew.
Draft.  Clear golden amber, white head.  Citrusy, orange peel, a bit eathy hops, and light grain, very dry.  A nice sessionable beer.  Very good.

Pours orange with a big bubbled white head. Grapefruit and lemon hop aroma. Silky mouthfeel, nice hop flavor, bready, all in perfect balance. Just simply a APA in a category all by itself. Wonderful, a beer that truly excites me and reminds me how good a non-imperial....indeed almost sessionable....beer can be.

Bottle from City Beer Store in San Francisco. This is a great APA. Aroma is strong simcoe hops, flavor is nicely balanced, but the simcoe is still forward. Really nice session, could drink this all day.
500 ml from Blackwells. Really nice pour. Very clean looking APA. Tons of simcoe in aroma. Taste is hoppy and bitter, but a smooth bitterness. Grapefruit. Pine. Fantastic.

A very delicious pale ale. I enjoyed it more than I thought I would. I wish it was easier to get in NJ.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2012 OBF. Crisp and clean. Lemon, grapefruit and pine. Well balanced. A hint of caramel in the background. Tasty.
These west coast guys are finally learning how to hop like the northeast. Very close to Maine beer mo. Great citrus aroma and slighted bitter finish.

Clear orange pour. Nose is citrus fruits, oranges, moderate amount of pine, and other resinous nuances. Flavor is surprisingly lacking hop flavor compared to the aroma and light malt flavor and dry. Not all that bitter. Really a nice easy drinking pale. Hats off to Russian river again. They are really good at making dry beer.
Simcoe is all I need. Definitely a bit more than your average APA. These guys just know their way around hops.

Cloudy dark gold pour with frothy white head.  Good cling.  Very nice looking beer.  Nose is bready with hops and light fruit.  Taste is a nice blast if hops buy very little fruit.  Good not great.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours clear apricot gold with white head. Nose/taste of pineapple, melon, citrus fruits, malt, cut grass and slight vitamins. Medium body. Finishes slightly dry.

draft at Beachwood BBQ in Seal Beach.  lightly hazed pale gol body with a white head.  medium strength nose of simcoe tropical / citrus fruit juice and pith with some leaf vegetables notes and a slight calcium / vitamin note.  flavor is much the same though more of a cut grass character stands out, along with softer floral honeydew melon and pine notes.  medium-light body with moderately coarse hop acid and bitterness and a finish that turns a bit too watery.
Tap at OBF. Pours hazy orange with a creamy white head. Mild sour grapefruit aroma. Med body. Flavor is lightly sour grapefruit. Nice smooth, bitter rind finish.

Clear pale gold. Some foamy white head. dank pine aroma, maybe some fruit rind as well. Taste is mostly piney bitter hops. But its fantastic. This is how all single hop beers should be. Minimal malt flavor, whats there is just to showcase the simcoe and Im a big fan.

500ml bottle, dated 6/26/12, courtesy of summer secret santa 2012. thanks, mike! pours exactly as a pale ale should with a pure, clean, golden color capped by a rich, soapy, bright white head that leaves sticky rings of lace. aroma is outstanding with big, sticky, resinous pine, pink grapefruit, orange peel, and lemon zest backed by subtle floral esters and a touch of toast. flavor is delicious as well, just so clean and bright, with citrus notes of tangerine, grapefruit peel, and light lemon backed by notes of soap, pine resin, and light, toasted malts with a hint of caramel sweetness. palate is on the lighter side of medium bodied with crisp carbonation and a clean, fruity, bitter finish. overall, another great pale ale from russian river.

(Draught)  Pours a lightly hazy golden orange with a medium white head.  Aroma of grapefruit, pine, tangerine, earth, and mango.  Flavor of grapefruit, pine resin, grass, and earth with a dry, bitter finish.

Draught @ the brewpub. Rated on 21.07.2012
Aroma is fruity with lots of mango and some passion. Flavour has resin, fruits and passion. Somewhat sweet but refreshing anyway.

Poured from bottle.  Pours golden with a bit of foamy white head.  Aroma is slightly floral hops and light grapefruit.  Taste is floral hops, some citrus and a bit of hay/grass.  A nice summer refresher.
Pale gold pour with a cream head.  Nose is citrus, grapefruit, earth, and faint spice.  Easy on the palate, nice grapefruit flavor, fruits, and a nice finish.

(500ml bottle) clear medium gold, lasting film of white bubbles. Nose of candied citrus, bit of umami, honey, fresh and delicious. Taste of biscuit, bit malty, lacks a strong bitterness and citrus flavor, cracker and light melon. Malty finish, lightly spicy finish.
Pours yellow very thin head. Aroma is mild with some hop character. Tastes nice. Mildly bitter a very nice brew just bitter enough. Pretty good.

This poured a bright darker yellow color with a fluffy white head.  Aroma was straigh simcoe hops, lots of citrus, light pine and dankness too,with light crackery notes in a background.  Taste is fruity, fresh hops, a bit one dimensionl of course, with very little maltiness to get in the way. Very dry and straight to the point. Nice Nice stuff.

Draught @ Brewpub, Santa Rosa.
Rated on 20120721.
Pours clear golden color with small head. Aroma of hops, fruits, mild pale malts and toffee. Flavor of fruits, hops, hay and caramel. Nice.
3414

Draft at Russian River. Pours clear honey-gold; thin white head, fantastic lacing. Nose is persimmon, cream, baking poweder biscuits, so lifted, so pretty, lots of grapefruit coming through here as well, obviously. Flavours of creamed grapefruit, rosewater, tropical fruit, mineral, cream, and quine. Very dry, and staggeringly pretty. No complaints here!

Sample at the Pints For Pelotonia charity tasting on 07/21/12: This beer is a clear copper-orange color with a medium white head that diminishes slowly. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of pine, hops and fruit. Light to medium body with a crisp citrusy hops character and notes of pine and biscuit malt. The finish is dry and hoppy with a grapefruit aftertaste. Good beer all around.
On tap at brewery. Clear golden with a fizzy white head. Huge pine grass and grapefruit aroma and taste with a decent bitterness and a smooth thick palate. Very good.

A: citrus, pineapple, pomegranate, orange juice, grapes, and some pine. P: Hazy yellow, with a thin white head. T: some nice tropical fruits, and lime, a nice balance between the bitterness, hops, and carmel malt. M: very lively beer, nice carbonation, somewhat bitter and sticky. O: very impressive, i never knew simcoe was this good.

Appearance: Pours a mostly clear, slightly hazy amber tinted yellow gold with visible rising bubbles. A top sits white cap of foam that stays for the duration of the session.

Aroma:  Unbelievably dank and citrusy. Smells of hard candy and a touch of pine too.

Taste:  A big green mouthful of hops, very piney and earthy. Some citrus twang and spicy dry malt.  Finishes bone dry and bitter that lingers and leaves behind a dank herbal aftertaste.

Mouthfeel: Medium bodied, juicy, with very modest prickles.

Overall:  This beer is killer, and very fresh.  Im a big fan of simcoe hops, but dont recall a single hopped simcoe beer that had the best of all worlds like this (bitter, juicy, herbal, dank). I look forward to more beers from this new series.

From tap at Blind Lady. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is crisp hoippy, mango, peachy and citrusy. Smooth fruity and crisp hoppy.  Smooth fruity, peachy and light citrusy into a mellow fruity and light bitter finish.

On tap at Tustin Brewery. Citrus & hops on the nose. Pours golden in color with thin white head & lacing. Hops dominate the flavor with grapefruit and pine notes. Long lasting & satisfying finish. Awesome beer.

Tap at brewpub-Yep, another home run here from this fantastic brewery-pours very lite orange with a small soapy white head with sparse lacing.  nose is dank!!!!  fresh hop dankness lots of citrus and tropical simcoe action here.  This hop is doing it for me this year (previous years not so much).  flavors are tons of tropical notes to start out with-papaya, mangos followed by a lovely woody pine finish.  this beer is very similar to Erways LaCumbre Simcoe Pale ale he brewed a few months ago.  Fantastic!

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured clear copper color with an average frothy off-white head that lasted with excelleny lacing. Moderate to heavy simcoe hop aroma. Moderate to heavy bitter flavor with a moderate to heavy bitter finish of medium to long duration. Medium body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. This is a standout beer.

Tap @ PP Carlsbad.  Light golden yellow pour with a nice froth of white foam and rings of lacing down the glass.  Aroma is clean pine and hops with subdued bitterness and a complimentary floral smell.  Taste is clean, even bitterness intermixed with light citrus and a dry maltbackbone.  Clean, crisp mouthfeel.  Hugely drinkable and quite good.

Tap at PPC. Chill haze golden with moderate lacing. Nose is mellow, small pineapple. Fresh cantaloupe. Sweet mango. Small vanilla and sea salt. Very nice. Taste is tangy and moderately bitter with a major quenching character.  Mango juice. Easy to drink. A tad powdery and dry. But delicious. No sugar, no nuttiness, no astringency. Great stuff. Will not hold up for long bottle like blind pig.
