Bottle. Clear, light golden with big, fluffy off-white head. Aroma of blackberries, tropical fruity hops, grass, tangerine, cereal and light citrus. Very nice. Taste is dry and medium bitter with nice biscuity maltiness and simcoe hops. Very refreshing. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Well balanced and drinkable.

Very light and very refreshing.  Pours light, super thin.  Aroma is light, floral, aromatic hops, with some pine and bitterness.  Palate is pine, slight citrus, super duper thin, and its gone.  Its very light and refreshing.  Not amazing palate, but very nice.

This has Russian river written all over it. Soon as you open the bottle you get a whiff of thenrussian river hops and awesomeness. Pours a light orange yellow color. Taste A few hops. Pretty light beer overall. Awesome pale ale

Churchill Pub in San Marcos, Calif., on July 14, 2012. Draft into pint glass. Honey pale color. Two fingers of head once I got it. Gray and tan lacing with good retention. Even on the sides and foamy.

Smelled a sharp whiff of grapefruit right away. Slight pine and lemon as well. Very bitter.

Sharp bitter taste right away. Grapefruit citrus hops dominated as expected after the smell. 

Medium-to-light body. Thin texture. Average carbonation. Bitter abrupt finish.

A pretty good beer overall, but I was a bit disappointed overall. That being said, Id still give it another go.

Bottle from Whole Foods Pasadena; the aroma on this is insane and instantly recognizable as a Russian River ale. Clear and bright orange color. Taste is so fruity and good, really enjoyable fresh pale ale. Loved it.

Pint at Urge. Pours a cloudy orange. The aroma is a blast of pure, wet hops. There are layers of grapefruit, lemon zest, pineapple and dankness. This is light bodied for as hoppy as it is. There isnt a real stickiness or heaviness, just a solid, huge wash of hops on the palate. More herbs and pineapple in the flavor. Very sessionable with its lighter mouthfeel and brilliant hop presence.  I could drink a lot of these.
Bottle. Pours clear gold with light head. Aroma is melon, pine and funk. Flavor is citrus and pine. Fairly light in body with medium carbonation. Just slightly bitter. Clean crisp finish.

Bottle thanks to my Summer Secret Santa! Pours a clear gold with a near white head that lasts throughout the beer. Aroma has a decent amount of pine with a hint of onion with a grain backbone. Flavor has strong pine hops with notes of grass and onion backed by a nice light grain note.

500ml bottle. thanks to baker. bottled date of 06262012.  pre-race beverage carbload... pours a slightly hazy, mostly transparent pale slightly darker than cider hue and topped with a medium soapy white head that gently recedes, leaving a frothy film around the edges... the aroma consists of a medium citrus focus adjoined by notes of grass.  pale biscuity malts provide a backbone but the hops play the dominant role.  a light perceived sense of bitterness offered by the grassy tones also take play... flavors are more of the same with crisp citrus overtones again meshing with an almost equal degree of grassiness.  clean crackery biscuity malt provides support.  the finish leaves a light bitter sensation on the palate that prolongs and extends after consumed.  light to medium bodied, more so the former, with crisp semi-lively carbonation.  would gladly have again.

Pours a nice golden orange with a foamy white head with tight carbonation and nice lacing.  Aroma is of pine resin, spruce, cedar, orange and tangerine, some grass, and some biscuit malts.  Taste is of pine resin, spruce, cedar, orange, tangerine, freshly cut grass/weeds, biscuit malts, and some sweet malts in the background.  Has a medium body with a creamy mouthfeeel, nice lively carbonation,  and a long bitter,but  well balanced, champagne like dry finish.  Overall, a very tasty and refreshing APA that is great on a warm day.

Location/Date:Bottle on July 12th, split with Dave and Bryan.
Appearance: Pours a copper orange.  
Aroma: Aroma of sweet citrus, faint rye. 
Taste: Medium bitterness, citrus, hint of rye.   
Palate:Light body, quick finish.
Summary: First off, thanks to Bryan for acquiring this while out in SF!  I really enjoyed this beer, very well made.  I get some rye to the flavor, maybe Im alone on this.

13 July 2012, bottle. Yellow, clear, no bubbles. Nose is a bit resins and skunky. Not impressed. Thin body and a bit fizzy. Tastes of wet dead grass, light cereal malt, faintly skunky. Not impressed at all. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottle thanks Dan. Pours light orange with frothy head aroma of grass and floral. taste is very hop forward and easy drinking.

500 ml bottle. Pours a translucent copper color with a small white head that has fair retention. The aroma features oranges, weeds, grass and a bit of bong-water. The flavor is similar to the nose with oranges in the forefront and peaches, green weeds and limes filling in the back and sides. The malt base is dominated by biscuit and the palate is thick and viscous with lively carbonation. Finishes long and dry. Overall: Top shelf.

500 mL bottle, shared with Greg from CK. Pretty clear orange amber pour with a nice looking white frothy head. Gorgeous nose with huge earthy notes of dirt and loam, stunning classic Simcoe characteristics of pine sap, spruce needles, and rich, dark tangerine citric qualities. The flavor brings more of the same, with a lovely hop bouquet that is oh so drinkable. An awesome APA, second only to the likes of HF Edward, but in that same tier.

Bottle to snifter at home. Poured a beautiful glowing orange, with a fluffy white head. Smell is loaded with tropical fruits, flowers, peaches, and tangerines. Taste is a touch more pine/grass forward, but still as floral notes, and flavors of tropical fruits but the ending bitterness is quite different; almost grapefruit peel tasting. Still, very smooth, but definitely has an IPA-like bitterness. Medium mouthfeel with champagne-like carbonation. Pretty damn good APA, and Im glad I got a chance to try this one. Cheers!
Tap. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich flowers, hops, peach, pine and malt.

pours a golden yellow with about an inch of very light fluffy head, a bit chunky. total tropical citrus domination. juicy and sweet. light tropical citrus hop flavor with a very light and thin malt flavor towards the end. very fresh and ripe. light and easy, mild carbonation. very easy to drink, very flavorful and never overpowering. light malt lets the simcoe shine. Reviewed on: 07-11-2012
Bottle to snifter (thanks alexsdad06). Looks good; orange and transparent with thin lacing. Smells good too; bitter hops. Tastes good, but a little thin. Still, damn good beer!
I am not usually a Simcoe fan but this is such a well balanced beer.  Pours a light yellow with lots of tiny bubbles and a big aroma this really works.  They know how to do hops.

Sampled from the bottle thanks to Robert and Best Damn. Pour is a golden clear color with a nice white head. Aromas of lemon and citrus. Smooth and medium light body.  Flavors follow suit with earthy hop goodness with orange, lemon and tangerine notes. Bitterness is present but not over powering and super balanced with the malt. Of course a typical RR dry finish. Great way to sample the Simcoe characteristics.
17.25 ounce bottle from brewery.  Thick disappearing head, floral aroma, some bitterness at finish but not much.

Great full IPA flavor with a lighter body. Great for hot summer day. Rich transparent gold color.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Served from a 500 mL bottle from Barons. The appearance is a clear pale white gold with a beautiful foam white head. Wonderful floral and light pine hop aromas. Flavors of grapefruit zest, with a clean fresh hop smoothness rides on some bready malts and a light kiss of woody notes. The mouth is pretty drying and the bittering dryness grows for a long finish. Another superb beer from Russian River.

Thought Id rated this. Guess not. 500mL bottled 06/26/12, $4.99 at Olive Tree Market in OB. Clear golden with a one finger white head, pretty decent retention. Grapefruit pith and mild pine hop nose, light perfumey citrus following with a pale cracker malt backbone. Flavor follows, but man, the hops are so bright. Not a ton of pine, but plenty of grapefruit citrus.  The best part is the bitterness--there really isnt much.  Dry finish with bitterness peaking around a 3ish. Moderate carbonation with a light to medium body.  Just as good as the couple pints I had at Toronado SD during CBC 12
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Bottle thanks to hannont...  Poured golden/amber-ish with a fluffy, white head.  Nose was almost absent here.  Tasted rather tame.  It really didnt seem like the simcoe hops shinned here; and theyre one of my favorite hop varieties.  Light fruits and present malts, low bitterness and yeast esters.  A little bit drying towards the finish.
Bottle. Amber beer with a nice cream head. Grapefruit and summer fruit aroma with malt. Grapefruit and light summer fruit flavor. Medium bodied. Grapefruit and pine linger with light summer fruit.

Bottle @ City Beer: Citrus and pine -- apparently, its Simcoe. Elsewhere, ... Airy off-white head with a nearly opaque (and very lively) straw-gold body. Somewhat spritzy yet with a juicy mouthfeel. Leaves itself on the dry and bitter end. Nice beer to introduce during these heatwaves. Simple and good. Its a very nice tribute beer. However, I dont go crazy for the hop when its by itself so I find nothing great about it. To style, to highlight this hop, ... Its amazing. But, Im an ass. I go for personal taste here.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2012 Pale golden pour. The nose is a little bit spicy with a bit of orange and some toast. Lean malt and a bit of pine. Moderately tropical but dusty pine and some light spice. Fresh and very tasty. 

Clear amber gold pour with a little bit of a soft white head. The nose is a little bit fruity and some soft spiciness. Pine and a little bit of soft fruitiness.  Light peachy character. A touch of soft fruitiness. Solid APA.

Aroma: fresh floral hops, grapefruit, some light toasty malts and a faint background sweetness.  Pours clear golden with a white head, good retention and a nice uniform coating of lace.  Flavor: nice mellow bitterness, fruity hops, pine and grapefruit, bready/toasty malts, clean and dry finish.  Light-medium body and medium carbonation.  Excellent APA.

On tap at Monk's for RR/SN diner. This pours a gorgeous, glowing golden orange with a fluffy, tightly bubbled off-white head. Aroma of dank Simcoe hops, freshly tilled soil, freshly cut onions and chives, subtle citrus, and some more sweet, sweet onion funk. Holy shit, the aroma is DANK. Medium to light bodied with a very oily, resinous, slick, beautiful palate. Flavor is ripe tangerine, clementine, mandarin orange and honeydew, with some amazing oniony, savory bite. Finish is clean and oiled out. Holy hell. This is, hands down, the best pale ale I've ever tried, rivaled only by FFF Zombie Dust. Sublime pale ale. Thanks for the taste, Vinnie. Please send more of this to Philly.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Monks for Russian Riv/Sierra Nevada dinner, pours a slightly hazy gold color with medium white head and very nice lacing patterns. Aromas are overwhelming simcoe and creamy melon hop notes, light onion cheese, cantalope, grass. Taste is pineapple, grapefruit, dank resinous pine, lemon fuel. Perfectly done, and only a little bit bitter. Smoother then Hill Farm Edward. Amazing. Would love to have growlers of this to sess on. Silky palate. Unreal

A - pours  clear apple juice color with no head. S - strong grapefruit citrus and piney hops. Notes of tropical fruit as well. M - nice medium body with average carb. Nice malty backbone after a string but pleasing hoppy nose. T - grapefruit and pine up front. Strong caramel malt backbone. Lingering grassy bitterness. O - very good ipa. Strong but not too bitter. 7/7+
UPDATED: MAY 21, 2012 CBC on tap-pours yellow with a tight white head.  Aroma is lemon zest/herbal, some light malt.  Taste is lemon/herbal hops, some light malt.

Draught  Small off-white hed, fully hazy but bright orange beer. Extremely fruity C-hops with citrus, passion fruit, melon. Intensely fruity & inviting. Dry bitter fruity flavours with bitter melon, bitter passion fruit (exists?) and grapefruit. Very slick, hopoily, medium bodied. Excellent (I) Pale ale, worthy of the brewery.

Half pint draft at the brew up in Santa Rosa, California.  The pour is mostly clear golden orange with a smallish off white head.  Nice lacing left behind as the beer drinks down.  The aroma is a blast of super fresh citrus, grapefruit and tangerine, and a great underlying resin character that really holds the aroma.  Bready toasted malt is present as well, also crazy fresh smelling.  The taste really balances the zip of the citrus hops with the dry body of the toasted malt.  The resin kicks in, and gives it an added "dankness" that really sets it apart from the IPA, that I tasted side by side.  The palate is medium to light bodied, crisp active carbonation and a dry finish.   So fresh, so good.

Huge thanks to daysinthewake for getting this growler out my way. Served in a Russian River goblet.

Pours a clear peach color with a nice white head and pretty good retention. Nice lacing as it falls to a collar. The nose carries some tropical fruits along with a bit of citrus and a touch of pine. Really nice nose with multiple dimensions. Its not particularly over the top, either. Flavor is similar, but scaled back a little too much. Body is light-medium with good carbonation and a solid bitterness. Quite good.
Draft at RR. Nose is pine and citrus. Clear yellow with a small pale yellow head. Flavor nicely bitter with lots of pine a little citrus and some light sweetness in the background.

On tap at Russian River. Better aroma and flavor than Zombie Dust an Alpha King...cleaner and more crisp Simcoe hops. Love this beer as the perfect-drinking pale ale. Great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Taster at RR brewery. Pours a light copper color with a floral aroma. Definately more piney hop in it. Not my favorite style of beer which probably knocked it down a couple of basis points. Overall a very solid beer.

Pours a clear golden amber color with a tall white head.  Nice fresh citrus hoppiness. Tons of grapefruit, lots of tangerine as well. Pine and a hint of grass with sweet bready malt. The flavor is a bit sweet, but good pine and grapefruit. A little bit of floral hop character as well. Nice beer, easy to drink.
nicely done single hope pale here, shows off the simcoe perfectly, i get a bit more fruityness than i am used to in this beer. well done as usual, worth trying if you pass through!

Light orange pour, white head.  BOOM! Citrus hops jumping out of the glass, resinous goodness! Just enough caramel malt.  Flavor is big hops up front and then more hops.  Just enough balance before you finsih on a hop high. Hell yeah!

On draft at the brewpub. Beatification batch 5 release. This beer was being buzzed about throughout the crowd that day as a pretty phenomenal APA. I have to agree. The pour was a nice clear golden orange with an off white head. The aroma jumped out as super floral with some resinous pine and citrus. Just awesome. The flavor was incredibly well balanced and still a punch in the face as far as hoppiness goes. Lots of pine, citrus and some very minor sweet malt to set off the hop assault. Very drinkable and flavorful. Loved this one. One of the best APAs out there.

Much more of a hop presence than Segal (had side by side).  Neither beer is going to knock your socks off around RR, though this could easily be the best beer at many micros.  A nice experiment and I am glad I was able to get a glass of it, but this doesnt come close to some of their other offerings.

Tap @ RR. Clear gold pour with a short white head with good retention and leaving moderate lace. Nose is lightly fruity and chemical as fresh- or wet- hop ales can do. Medium-light body and moderate carbonation. Toast, biscuit and delicious Simcoe hops (citrus, tropical fruit). Finish is medium and very tasty, with a hoppy bitterness, some umami from the fresh hops and a light sweetness. Must be drunk fresh - a growler drunk the next week wasnt nearly as good (0.3-0.4 worse total score) due to a lack of aroma and taste balance was off.

From a growler.  Pours a clear light amber with small white head that has good retention and leaves some light lacing on the glass.  The aroma is big pine hops, some dankness, some light caramel , and a bit of grapefruit.  This certainly smells amazing like most Russian River hoppy beers.  The taste follows the nose, with pine, grapefruit, and a dankness.  Just a enough malt comes through to balance it with a little bit of caramel and sugar cookie.  The finish has a decent bitterness to it.  Medium-light body.  Moderate carbonation.  Quite dry throughout.  Another great Russian River beer.

Served from a growler.  Strong pine hop aroma with a hint of citrus.  Smells nice, crisp.  Good, bright orange color.  Mild pine flavor, a little bit of citrus and bitterness comes out towards the end.  The flavors arent too strong, leaving room for a good amount of drinkability.  The finish seems to be a little light in the flavors, there is a slight amount of bitterness that sticks around after a few sips.  The mouthfeel is pretty light.  Overall, this is a very good pale ale.  It exceeds expectations for the style, and is among the best pale ales Ive had.

A - This beer pours a a golden-orange color that is fairly clear with a finger of frothy white head atop. The head fades down slowly leaving behind some nice lace clinging to the sides of the glass.

S - The aroma is full of lots of pine and citrus hops smells. There is some nice grapefruit and topical fruits as well as some floral elements.

T - The flavor starts off with lots of fresh piney and tropical hop flavor with some mellow bitterness that starts to grow on the tongue. Bit of grapefruit as well. Through the middle, the grapefruit, orange, and pineapple hop flavors get quite a bit stronger with some stronger bitterness coming through as well. There is just enough sweet toasted malts to keep a nice balance as well. The finish is full of pine resin and citrus hops with some more bitterness and some light sweet malts.

M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Smooth with a really nice dry and bitter finish.

D - Very drinkable. The hop flavor and aroma is just fantastic on this beer. It is so fresh and strong from start to end without being overpowering. The beer also stays quite sessionable.
Draft at Russian river, golden orange. Healthy sim or aroma, not overly aromatic. Great bitterness in the flavor, wonderful showcase of this hop
Another fantastic ipa from russian river. SImcoe hope pine aroma with a flavor that finishes bitter.

Growler shared by beerboxer. Pours clear golden with a rich white head that quickly subsides and a fruity cat piss aroma. There is a nice caramel malt base with a serious hop bitterness. Very nice hopping.
Smells like pliny the elder. Thanks to the simco hops. Its the perdominate hop in plinys. Great beer really makes the simco stand out

16oz pint at the brewpub pours a totally clear, deep gold with some lacing white head.  Nose has a similar profile to the Pliny; zesty, lemons, scallions, onion patch, lime zest.  Smells almost like a Russian River version of Gumballhead.  Flavor is sweet, zesty lemons, limes, oranges, scallions, onions, a little malty.  Medium bodied, dry, zesty finish.  Super drinkable.

On tap at the source. To be honest, better than Blind Pig on that particular day (1/27/12), but not quite as good as that batch of PtE. Often I find BP at the brewpub better than PtE, so this even being in the running is saying QUITE a bit!. Pours with a clear golden hue with a lasting white head with great lace. Aromas are of tropical fruit, pine, dank, tangerine, grape fruit and papaya. A light grainy flavor, but that is an afterthought. Flavors are all hops and grain (as it is with awesome sessionable beers). Grain, not caramel. Flavors are of tropical fruit hop notes, grass, and mild pine and grapefruit. Dry, grainy, light esters. Perfect balance for a hoppy session. Lively bubbles and dry. I feel this is the way of the future. At least for west coast session beers. A blue print (even as a single hop) beer right here.
on tap at the brewery.  incredible hop aroma, citrus, pines, etc, which outdid blind pig.  only knock would be the short finish.  light malts are perfectly balanced with the hops.

Deep golden, copper hue, apparent resins on the surface, light pure white foam. Impressive, full aroma - hoppy light phenols of bubblegum, sweet pine, light must, light medium body, backed by finer caramels. Snappy, crisp feel. Quaffable. WOW.

Draft @ Russian River. Pours a bright, clear, slightly effervescent golden-orange color; solid, fine-bubbled white head with sturdy lacing and retention. Assertive Concord grape notes with a softer pine presence and grapefruit juice; dank and dense citrus. Medium body; medium-high CO2. Following the nose, a vibrantly bitter pale ale with a grape-like note and a pine quality that meshes closely with grapefruit-y citrus. Tasty, dank, lightly tongue-numbing, with a softly bitter finish: on the dry side.
